Emma,
Check-out how Peak Democracy Inc is working with innovative towns, cities, counties and elected officials 
across the US to implement online public comment forums that are civil, fair, legal, insightful, guided, easy and cost-effective. Peak Democracy is spearheading this new form of online civic engagement:  http://www.PeakDemocracy.com.
Mike

answers.author: Stephanie Klinkenberger
answers.text:
In an Information Week article dated May 16, 2011, there is information about New York City’s usage of social networking for governmental purposes.  The article focuses on how social media can be used to enhance community engagement. Amongst the City Departments using social networking are the Office of the Mayor and the Department of Small Business Services.  
http://www.informationweek.com/news/government/state-local/229500704

author: Emma Jurado
text:
A student at the John Glen School at Ohio State University requests feedback on Social Media within local government.  Specifically, they are looking for information on who the leading innovators in local governments are, what they are doing, and how they are implementing these ideas.
Your help is much appreciated!
title: Innovations in Social Networking
